courseDescription: This course provides a comprehensive overview of infection prevention and control principles and practices relevant to community health nursing. It covers various aspects, including infectious disease concepts, risk factors, modes of transmission, standard precautions, sterilization techniques, waste management, and barrier nursing guidelines.

modules.moduleTitle: Introduction to Infection Prevention and Control
modules.moduleDescription: Overview of concepts, objectives, and infectious disease patterns.
Understanding who is at risk, the disease cycle, and microbial agents.
Exploring transmission in healthcare, spread of infections, and key definitions.
Introduction to standard precautions and hand washing.
Detailed instruction on proper hand washing techniques and related policies.
An overview of personal protective equipment, focusing on gloves.
Exploring different types of gloves, gowns, masks, and other protective gear.
Introduction to instrument processing and the use of antiseptics and disinfectants.
Detailed look at common antiseptics and disinfectants.
Continuation of common antiseptics and disinfectants.
Further exploration of antiseptics and disinfectants, including high-level options.
Detailed look at high level disinfectants.

modules.moduleTitle: Low Level Disinfectants and Aseptic Technique
modules.moduleDescription: Understanding low level disinfectants and aseptic techniques.
Preparing patients and maintaining sterile fields.
Creating safe environments and managing sharps disposal.
Decontaminating needles, managing injuries, and post-exposure protocols.
Safe injection practices and the processing of instruments.
Detailed instructions on decontamination and preparing chlorine solutions.
Understanding the use of detergents and sterilization.
Deep dive into steam sterilization and autoclaving.
Proper storage techniques for sterilized items.
Exploring dry heat and chemical sterilization methods.
Techniques for performing HLD through boiling and chemicals.
The importance of housekeeping in infection prevention.
Different cleaning routines based on risk areas.
Proper methods for waste disposal in healthcare facilities.
Managing solid medical waste through sorting, handling, storage, and disposal.
Guidelines for proper disposal of various types of medical waste.
Detailed look at contact, droplet, and airborne precautions.
Introduction to barrier nursing principles and guidelines.
Considerations and standards of care in barrier nursing.
Hand washing, patient care, and protective clothing in barrier nursing.
Equipment, linen, sharps, environment, food and visitor guidelines for barrier nursing.
Educating staff and patients on barrier nursing practices.
Educating the community and understanding the standard layout of barrier areas.
Barrier nursing requirements for one patient and specifications for gowns and aprons.
Specifications for caps, masks, gloves, boots, and eye wear and the observation tray.
Application of the nursing process to barrier nursing, and reading materials.

prerequisites: Interest in infection prevention and control
